item.title: Manager- Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager- Data Analytics

Job Description

  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights
  • Build reporting that measures the success of new pricing strategies under Customized Pricing, measuring champion vs. challenger performance and make strategy recommendations
  • Utilize pricing optimization tool to create pricing proposal based on previous results and current rate environment.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes and expose timely and relevant information to end-users
  • Work with the HEF Pricing team and others to advice on pricing decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies
  • Participate in building new predictive model to enable insights and facilitate pricing decision making process
  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support senior leaders in managing the pricing strategy for the Home Equity portfolio
  • Create materials to communicate insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions
  • Monitor the use of delegated pricing authorities to ensure compliance

Must-have  

  • 2-4 years of experience in an analytical and reporting capacity supporting a line of business across major Financial Institution(s).  
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide insights to senior management
  • SQL knowledge and experience, including developing and optimizing complex queries
  • Proficient in use of SAS, Tableau, Excel, PPT, or other data visualization tools
  • Self-starter—ability to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner
  • Excellent communication skills along with ability to partner effectively with and direct both internal and external partners

Nice-to-have

  • Passionate about the mortgage industry, and being part of a greater team
  • Knowledge of Data Science / predictive modelling / machine learning is an asset
  • Experience in Python and R programming
  • Knowledge of Linx, experience with RBC database and mortgage data  (only show on internal posting)

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

RBC Home Equity Financing (HEF) is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over $300 Billion in assets.
As the Manager, Data Analytics within HEF Pricing Team, you will use advanced analytics to provide senior leadership insights into the impacts of pricing strategies on the HEF portfolio. Also, you will maintain reporting package that focuses on the pricing aspect of the HEF business that will help drive key decisions with a high degree of impact. Furthermore, you will leverage pricing optimization tools to generate monthly pricing proposal under Customized Pricing strategies.

item.title: Manager, Process Improvement & Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Process Improvement & Data Analytics

Job Description

 What will you do?

  • Key member of the Data3Sixty Analyze logic building and maintenance team within Finance & Controller group
  • Analyze processes, gather requirements and look for solutions to improve
  • Build the automations and see them through the cycles of UAT, implementation in production, warranty period support and hand over to business as usual
  • Assist on various technology and automation projects within the group
  • Main contact for quick hits as technology expert in F&C group
  • Perform Derivatives GL booking difference analysis and intergroup trade matching in order to rectify any discrepancies
  • Work through ad hoc requests at peak times based on quarterly reporting needs

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting/Finance or IT/ Data Science with 2-4 years minimum work experience
  • 2+ years technical experience working with various automation tools and large data sets. Ability to implementing large to medium size projects.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and logical thinking skills
  • Technical competencies including sound knowledge of standard PC software (Strong knowledge of Microsoft applications: Access, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
  • Experience programming
  • Good organizational, coordination, written and interpersonal skills

Nice-to-have

  • Post graduate degree such as MBA or IT/Finance related designation
  • Some knowledge and experience with Finance systems
  • Data3Sixty Analyze experience
  • MS Excel VBA experience

Job Summary

Working with Director Finance & Controller Process Excellence you will be looking at automations and process improvement opportunities within Finance & Controller group. The role will involve working with the business to understand process in order to drive continuous improvement, automation and innovation mainly related to large data sets and through the use of various tools at disposal such as Data3Sixty Analyze, Cognos Disclosure Manager, Excel, VBA, Tableau and any new tools identified with potential use cases. In this role you will also assist in some business as usual work, mainly related to intergroup derivative reconciliation processes, remediation of breaks and matching of large data sets.

item.description:

Job Title

Manager, CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of the CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including the Lines of Business across Personal and Commercial Banking providing actionable insights and developing solutions that enhance the client experience and drive value for the business.

What will you do?

  • Deliver insightful and actionable analytics to underpin the Client Growth initiative enabling client acquisition and retention across all lines of business
  • End-to-end responsibility for campaign analyses including framing of analytical objectives with partners, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting key insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Examine and evaluate all facets of the marketing leads conversion process in order to produce key findings and recommendations that augment offer fulfillments
  • Analyze utilization of valuable outbound resources to optimize marketing opportunities for individual campaigns
  • Conduct marketing contact channel analyses to provide pertinent information and proposals supporting Client Interaction Strategy to enhance client experience and drive business values
  • Develop dashboards and monitor performance of various marketing channels to ensure client interactions are uniquely managed in the constantly evolving environment

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SQL and SAS
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skill and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management

item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues identifying  causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

Please Note: While the work arrangement for this opportunity is primarily remote, you may be required to periodically attend an approved RBC office location.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity
  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL
  • Ability to understand software requirements based on program specification
  • Demonstrated experience with building web application frameworks like flask
  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude
  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with machine learning and statistical techniques, testing/validation, visualizing data, test results and assess model performance
  • Experience with analytics, anomaly detection, model refinement and efficacy
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills
  • Experience with Git and process automation
  • Experience in UI/UX Design

What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Manager, Business Intelligence
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role you will support Caribbean Banking initiatives through analytic leadership and provision of regular and ad hoc reporting and analytics.  You will be responsible for advancing and improving data process automation capabilities and the end to end delivery of comprehensive reporting and data solutions which help optimize business results and inform fact-based decisions.

What will you do?

  • Lead the design, development, documentation and delivery of an array of reporting and analytical solutions, metrics and insights for various leadership teams in Caribbean Banking
  • Participate in business requirement and/or data gathering sessions with colleagues and internal partners to understand business opportunities and problems in the context of reporting requirements and recommend solutions
  • Support continuous improvement activities through use of available data sources and tools to enhance effectiveness and ensure reporting and analytics solutions continue to be seen as “value add” to respective stakeholders
  • Identify opportunities for efficiency and effectiveness and make appropriate recommendations pertaining to process streamlining and/or leveraging technology to enable automation, mitigate risk of error, and improve user experience
  • Act as SME both within the team and cross-functionally, on key performance measurements and provide insight through comprehensive analysis
  • Perform investigations, ad-hoc requests, data analysis and support reporting escalations
  • Promote and share best practices with teammates and stakeholders

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, related quantitative field, or equivalent related experience
  • Minimum of 2 to 4 years of experience in data analytics and/or data management
  • Demonstrated proficiency with large relational databases of different structures
  • Programming/coding skills and working experience in SAS, SQL
  • Oral and written communication skills to explain technical concepts, influence and build consensus

Nice-to-have

  • Basic understanding of Caribbean Banking business and technology environments
  • Programming/coding skills in Python

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities          

At RBC, the health and wellbeing of our employees and candidates is always our top priority.

Recruitment Process
COVID-19 has accelerated change across our workplace, including our hiring practices! As a result, throughout your application process, you may be asked to connect with us virtually, and may not be required to meet in-person. Our recruiters will explain how our video-interview technology will be used throughout the recruitment process, and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have.

Workplace Flexibility
You will be given the opportunity to work from home, if you can be fully productive, and role requirements including regulatory obligations can be satisfied. We are committed to supporting flexible work arrangements, investing in technology or other resources to enable you to work from home effectively, wherever possible.

Health & Safety
For employees that may be required to work from our premises, we’re doing our part to safeguard your health, and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All RBC premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

Job Summary

Manages the development, implementation and support of business analytics initiatives and projects. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Leverage complex data to provide analytics and strategic insights for business decisions and to explore new opportunities for Banking and Payments, including  
    • Detailed understanding of the product and segment analytics and financials
    • Business insight into acquisition and retention activities, channel performance and market share
    • Information in support of business optimization and business cases
    • Deep dives on new product innovation
    • Special projects as assigned
  • Work collaboratively with the Banking and Payments leadership team, and other analytics teams across the organization to enhance business decision-making through use of reporting, advanced analytics and combining multiple sources of data to measure key indicators of performance and early detection of opportunities, trends & anomalies.
  • Monitor and evaluate strategy effectiveness through the implementation of various tests (e.g. foundational testing, price optimization tests) and analysis on previous in-market tests and strategies.
  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new monthly / quarterly reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.
  • Work effectively with key stakeholders throughout the analytics and insights process to deliver high quality results aligned to the needs of the business.
  • Provide concise, timely and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to Banking and Payments portfolio.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.
  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools including Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders in defining and solving business problems.
  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment.
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business, engineering) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics.
  • 5+ years related work experience in analytics, product or quantitative strategy roles.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in building financial models /valuations
  • Experience with statistical tools, test design, and predictive analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Our Vision is to be Canadians’ leading choice for all payment and everyday banking activities, extending our market leading position through superior value, innovation, and differentiated experiences that drive acquisition and engagement.
In this role, you will be using data and analytics to improve our understanding of client behaviours, as well as improve in-market strategies and inform the design of our suite of products.
You will be working collaboratively with the broader Banking and Payments team, and use advanced analytical tools and multiple data sources (e.g. client segment data, bureau data, client behaviour data across all RBC products, online and mobile interaction data) in order to formulate strategies that optimize the business, enhance product construct, and provide value to our customers. Finally, you will be responsible for designing dashboards to support business reviews with Executives and complete deep dives to explain key trends and identify strategic opportunities.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management - GRM

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

As Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will execute and document validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Retail and Wholesale credit risk systems including Wholesale criteria paper models and wholesale, retail, and margin lending parameters (Probability of Default (“PD”), Loss given Default (“LGD”) and Exposure at Default (“EAD”)) used in both regulatory and economic capital. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

 

What will you do? 

  • Perform ongoing Retail and Wholesale credit risk systems including Wholesale criteria paper models and parameters validation and provide insightful analysis of validation results

  • Execute and document appropriate quantitative and qualitative tests, review of the logic and conceptual soundness of credit risk rating systems/wholesale criteria paper models/parameters and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, scenario and back testing, benchmarking and

  • Investigate and evaluate data filtering and data quality, relating to credit risk system validation

  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate

  • Review and document compliance with the minimum requirements for the Basel AIRB approach and model policy

  • Keep abreast of advances in credit risk validation analytics

  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, econometrics, finance or mathematics, and/or a relevant professional qualification

  • Strong knowledge of quantitative validation and vetting techniques

  • Strong computer skills - SAS, SQL and Excel required; Python and MatLab strongly preferred

  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures

  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills

 

Nice-to-have 

  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience

  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset.

  • Works well in teams 

What’s in it for you?  

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

As Senior Analyst, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will execute and document validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale and Retail credit risk systems including risk quantification used in both regulatory and economic capital. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems and parameters validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems including risk quantification validation.

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Stress Testing
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Stress Testing

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role of the Market Risk Stress Testing team is to ensure that the link between the current market environment across all asset classes and RBC’s market risk profile is established, understood, and managed effectively.  The team develops, implements, and analyzes stress scenarios to provide senior management, business heads, and regulators with views on market risk concentrations and capital adequacy.  The team is also responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory stress testing requirements for market risk.

As Associate Director, you are responsible for contributing to the team’s mandate, including the continued development of the market risk stress testing program, with an emphasis on the design, implementation and analysis of relevant scenarios. 

What will you do?

  • Conduct analysis on and produce summaries of potential concentrations and trends in risk that could result in significant financial loss under adverse market conditions. Demonstrate a deep, detailed understanding of trading and non-trading market risks at RBC as well as the current market environment, to provide senior management with confidence in the reasonableness of stress test outcomes such that action can be taken as deemed necessary
  • Participate in the scenario design process including identifying all material market risks, appropriately calibrating stress shocks, and reviewing and challenging scenario designs approaches and assumptions
  • Execute the market risk components of all regulatory stress tests – such stress tests are critical in assuring regulators that RBC is well-positioned to withstand severe but plausible market events.  Conduct thorough analysis, including detailed reviews and market research, to ensure the completeness and reasonableness of results
  • Document, challenge and provide expertise on market risk stress testing methodologies and assumptions across RBC.  These methodologies must be properly justified and documented in compliance with regulatory standards
  • Provide requirements in the design of key components of the strategic market risk platform that are related to stress testing, and test the IT builds before promotion to production
  • Gather findings and results of stress tests, methodology changes, and system changes to business heads and internal review committees

What do you need to succeed?

  • MBA, MA or MS or equivalent with emphasis in finance, economics or a quantitative discipline.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, including prior experience with presenting to senior audiences
  • Thorough knowledge of traded products including derivatives and their associated risks.
  • Detailed knowledge of MS Excel, SQL, and Python
  • Ability to work collaboratively and under tight deadlines

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. We offer:

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing
  • opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team in a growth area
  • Opportunities to do challenging work with enterprise impact

Job Summary

Responsible for contributing to the market risk stress testing program, with an emphasis on the design, implementation and analysis of relevant scenarios

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Management, RBC Global Asset Management (GAM), you will partner with business leaders, data governance and project teams to ensure the completeness and accuracy of enterprise data within Global Asset Management, with a focus on one or more assigned data domains. Build trust and confidence across the organization around enterprise data and data processes. This position will play an important role in GAM’s vision to become a data driven firm, and will serve as a go-to expert for the data that is managed by GAM’s Data Governance, and how to leverage it for business value. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Accountable for one or more specific enterprise data domains, you will work across the organization to understand enterprise data needs, data requirements and usage. Conduct research related to data requirements and present proposals to appropriate teams. Where needed, work across multiple business teams to achieve consensus on key data decisions including sourcing, classifications, and definitions.

  • Lead the work of one or more Data Working Groups, minute decisions and provide input to the Data Governance Council for key decisions that need to be escalated.

  • Define accountability for making data decisions – raise issues, risks and business decisions to appropriate teams.

  • Prioritize data work to ensure optimal value across projects and the organization

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data definitions, locations, and workflows.

  • Work with data squads to document and translate data requirements into technical requirements

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data within the organization.

  • In partnership with the data governance disciplines, business teams and business technology:

    • Document data definitions, create data quality controls and monitors

    • Develop data integration processes

    • Define operational workflows for maintaining data

    • Plan for data staging and delivery to reporting and downstream applications

  • Communicate regularly with project and business teams on data readiness and to identify data gaps and new requirement

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT/MIS/CS or related experience

  • Demonstrated reporting, data analysis experience, especially working with complex business processes and specific data domains

  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business users and technical individuals

  • Understanding of data flows, data architecture and data querying ability, including comfort with writing Oracle and MS SQL queries for data- mining and analysis

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in financial investment industry ideally within an asset management group

  • Decision making capabilities including problem solving approaches

  • Ability to solve specific business problems, while keeping an overall business and data vision in mind.

  • Experience working within a data warehousing environment.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Pricing Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Pricing Analyst

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Research, analyze and validate daily price discrepancies within valuation policy and monitor changes in the securities markets and investment regulations and their impact on daily pricing
  • Train staff on pricing process and methodologies across all instruments and assist staff with daily price challenges
  • Approve user supplied price (USP) files daily
  • Involved in price/data/application discussions with external vendors
  • Analyze market value impact of corporate actions and trade discrepancies against market data
  • Analyze Review security setup attributes for accuracy
  • Assist in pricing initiatives and enhancements and maintain internal pricing procedures/policies and ensure controls are followed
  • Monitor changes in the securities markets and investment regulations and their impact on daily pricing and resolve security price queries from internal/external audit

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Post-Secondary education in Finance or related field
  • Ability to work in a team environment, strong communication, time management, problem solving, attention to detail
  • At least 1-2 years experience with pricing/data applications such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv/Datascope,Thomson One Financial, Eagle, etc.
  • Experience with VBA/Macros, SQL, Tableau, Python
  • Security pricing experience:
    • Equity – Domestic, international, fair value pricing
    • Fixed Income – Plain vanilla, Convertibles, MBS, Strips, Real Return bonds, etc.
    • Derivatives - Futures, Options, Forwards, Swaps, Credit Default Swaps, Structured Products, etc.
    • Others – private placements, warrants, rights, restricted securities, etc

Nice to Have

  • Completion of I Canadian Securities Course (CSC) or CFA Level 1

What We Offer

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference for our clients and in our communities, and achieving mutual success:

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within RBC Global Asset Management

Job Summary

What is the Opportunity?

The Pricing Analyst, RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) is responsible for the daily pricing and analysis of a wide range of financial instruments for RBC GAM. As Pricing Analyst, you will apply analytical tools to assess the accuracy of security valuations by researching, analyzing and resolving issues according to established policies and procedures. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com

item.title: Associate Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management, GRM - 12 Month Contract
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management, GRM - 12 Month Contract

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As Associate Director, you work in close proximity with model stakeholders in order to vet and validate mathematical models used by RBC, mainly focusing on models related to Enterprise Market Risk (EMR).  You vet, validate and/or replicate, as necessary, various models (pricing, risk, etc.) used for VaR/SVaR and RWA regulatory capital for businesses and products used by the bank.  As Associate Director, you are a trusted advisor and effective challenger to model developers and users on all matters pertaining to EMR modeling requirements.  You ensure EMRM has proper understanding and documentation of the models’ business purpose and context and will facilitate RBC compliance with regulatory policies, guidelines, and procedures on model risk.

What will you do? 

  • Engage model builders (Market Risk, Quantitative Risk Analytics, etc.) and related function groups personnel as necessary in order to proactively assess, document, and independently validate mathematical models and their usage by the bank
  • Perform effective challenge of model inputs, methodology, and implementation
  • Acquire and maintain a thorough understanding of the flow and context of model usage by the business
  • Ensure that model users adhere to RBC model risk policy

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • 3+ years of work experience in mathematical modeling, preferably at a large financial institution, in a similar or related role such as a model developer/validator, a front office quant, a risk quant, or a risk manager
  • Broad exposure to and excellent knowledge of derivatives pricing and risk models for main product types (FIC, IR/FX, equity, commodity, securitized products, credit), and quantitative risk management methodology
  • Exceptional analytical, computational and critical thinking skills
  • Good familiarity with financial regulatory requirements and guidelines, such as OSFI CAR and FRB CCAR
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as physics, math, engineering, computer science, statistics, finance or financial engineering; Strong academic and research background may also count towards work experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

Job Summary

As Associate Director, you work in close proximity with model stakeholders in order to vet and validate mathematical models used by RBC, mainly focusing on models related to Enterprise Market Risk (EMR). You vet, validate and/or replicate, as necessary, various models (pricing, risk, etc.) used for VaR/SVaR and RWA regulatory capital for businesses and products used by the bank. As Associate Director, you are a trusted advisor and effective challenger to model developers and users on all matters pertaining to EMR modeling requirements. You ensure EMRM has proper understanding and documentation of the models’ business purpose and context and will facilitate RBC compliance with regulatory policies, guidelines, and procedures on model risk.

item.title: Manager, Business Strategy & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Strategy & Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Aligned with RBC’s commitment to drive new client growth, you will be responsible for developing insights and recommendations, which will transform how we make decisions to drive acquisition & retention across the portfolio, while maximizing the client experience as well as organizational value. In this role, you will report to the Senior Manager, Client Growth and Acquisition , and be a member of a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team, where you will be expected to contribute to team culture, consistent with the RBC Leadership Model.

What will you do?

Portfolio Analysis and Increased Client Acquisition (70%)

• Conduct portfolio analysis on various products (HP, LP, BP and BLIP) to create a fact base to better understand client and prospect behavior, including insights to support better decision making to achieve our client growth targets

• Generate insights based on distribution productivity, to support enablement with business growth objectives

• Develop reporting and presentations, and effectively communicating data-driven insights, opportunities and recommendations 

Relationship Management (30%)

• Collaborate with key partners across the organization to gather data/ insights to advance our client growth targets. Key partners include, but are not limited to teams within Creditor Insurance (Product, Enablement, Digital, Retention, Analytics), RBC Insurance (Marketing, Technology, Risk, Operations, Underwriters, Research), and P&CB (key stakeholders from various lines of business such as Home Equity Financing, Personal Lending, Cards, Business Financial Services)

What will you need to succeed?

• Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience

• Innovative and analytical thinker with the ability to process complex information and exercise sound judgment,

• Business acumen

• Ability to quickly adapt to changing circumstances and competing priorities

• Ability to participate on diverse cross-functional teams and/ provide input

• Strong Excel and Tableau skill sets

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

In this role, you will report to the Senior Manager, Client Growth and Acquisition , and be a member of a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team, where you will be expected to contribute to team culture, consistent with the RBC Leadership Model.

item.title: Director, Cards Credit Strategy
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Cards Credit Strategy

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC’s Portfolio Management & Credit Strategy team is seeking a Director, Cards Credit Strategy.  In this critical and specialized role you will drive portfolio growth and customer satisfaction through the design, recommendation and management of effective credit scoring and risk-based strategies to optimize the growth of RBC’s credit card business.

What will you do?

  • Support the Cards and Payment Solutions business targets for balance growth, activation and market share while maintaining the bank’s level of risk appetite.
  • Lead a team to develop and manage credit scoring strategy for new accounts and monitor new account performance
  • Manage credit losses, approval rates and activation to approved targets
  • Manage stakeholders through strategy change and approval process
  • Lead and develop a team of highly talented credit risk professionals
  • Foster thought leadership around credit card design and strategy. Evaluate new research to develop new methodologies and tools to enhance models and strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • At least 8 years’ financial services experience with a complete understanding of risk, finance and the issues specific to credit granting in a credit card environment
  • Expert knowledge of credit principles and risk management methodologies including credit scoring models and their application in account acquisition
  • Quantitative analytics background with a deep knowledge of advanced statistical tools (ex. SAS and SQL) and proven storytelling/presentation skills using PowerPoint.
  • Strategic knowledge of credit card acquisition channels
  • Proven leadership in fostering teamwork, cross-unit and cross-functional cooperation
  • Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and passion for exploring data to derive insights
  • An undergraduate degree in a quantitative field of study

item.title: Manager, AML Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, AML Data Management

Job Description

 

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

The AML Data Management team is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML and Financial Crimes Data Management Program that will govern data used within the enterprise to meet regulatory requirements and expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework.  You will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML and Financial Crimes (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring).  You will have an opportunity to liaise with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to maintain and enhance an effective and efficient AML and Financial Crimes Program at RBC.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?  

  • Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
  • Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
  • Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
  • Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
  • Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities
  • 5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases, data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
  • Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
  • Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations.  Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++  or other related experience desirable
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems
  • Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Financial Reporting Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Financial Reporting Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Join our growing RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) group! As Financial Reporting Analyst, you will provide support in the day-to-day operations and assist in preparation of financial statements and other related disclosures. You will also be involved in daily valuation and reporting of unit prices for assigned Mutual Funds within fixed deadlines enabling the unitholder systems to properly calculate the value of client’s holdings and process mutual fund transactions. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com

What will you do?

  • Assist in preparation of annual and semi-annual financial statements of mutual funds and other related disclosures

  • Prepare data for the Management Report of Fund Performance including Top 25 and Investment Mix reports

  • Support month-end general ledger close process

  • Assist in preparation of operating reports for IFIC and other industry/regulatory organizations

  • Provide financial information and assistance to external and internal auditors

  • Support daily fund accounting activities such as cash, holdings and sub-ledger to ledger  reconciliations and other month end controls

  • Ensure all transactions (i.e. corporate actions, unitholder subscriptions and redemptions, management fees, expense accruals, security trades) are entered into the GL System accurately to ensure accuracy of financial data

  • Create and implement solutions to streamline financial reporting processes

  • Maintaining internal procedures/policies to ensure controls are followed.

  • Train staff on operational processes and assist senior staff with daily process queries

  • Assist the reporting activities including taking on ad-hoc requests

  • Work on specialized projects including Eagle Investment and Electra systems

 What you need to succeed?

 Must have: 

  • Post-Secondary education in Finance or related field

  • 3+ years relevant industry experience

  • Ability to work in a team environment with strong communication, time management and problem solving skills

  • Practical knowledge of financial products, Mutual Fund valuation and general ledger systems.

  • Experience with MS Excel, VBA/Macros

  • High attention to detail and accuracy.

 Nice to have:

  • Completion or working towards Finance/Accounting designation

  • Experience with Tableau and database queries, including SQL

  • Knowledge of SS&C Pacer, Electra Recon and Eagle Investment Systems

item.title: Desk Focused Quantitative Analyst - Flow Rates Trading
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Desk Focused Quantitative Analyst - Flow Rates Trading

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to join a dynamic Quantitative Analytics team facing the Flow Rates Trading desk based in London. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing advanced pricing and risk management tools leveraging the Firm’s in house analytics and IT platforms, as well as providing cutting-edge analysis to the trading and sales teams. The role will require a sharp focus on the evolution of tooling framework and coordinating these efforts with the global Quantitative Modelling and Technology teams to ensure successful integration into the Firm’s systems and frameworks.

What will you do?

  • Partner with the trading desk to provide quantitative support to the business
  • Design and implement advanced pricing and risk management tools used directly by the trading and sales teams
  • Define and implement strategies for quantitative development including modernisation of the current framework and the techniques used within it
  • Provide technical leadership and expertise in the development and implementation of desk tools
  • Work closely and collaboratively with trading, sales and marketing to establish clear requirements and specifications
  • Work closely and collaboratively with IT partners to ensure that tools are fully and properly integrated into IT systems and applications according to business requirements
  • Provide input into the development of the shared Quant/IT architectural vision

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • High qualifications in mathematics and computing
  • Knowledge of vanilla interest rates derivatives, FX and cash products for trading, pricing and risk management
  • Solid experience in a Quant role, preferably desk facing
  • Strong experience in Front Office development software including Excel and Python
  • Knowledge of relevant applications and risk management systems and IT
  • Knowledge of regulatory and Anti-Money Laundering procedures
  • Understanding of front to back processes related to trading activity
  • Strong written and oral communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • A postgraduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as finance, economics, engineering, physics, mathematics or computing.
  • Knowledge of C++ beneficial
  • Understanding of capital market products (cross-asset)
  • Programme management and regulatory delivery knowledge

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Opportunity to join a dynamic Quantitative Analytics team facing the Flow Rates Trading desk based in London. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing advanced pricing and risk management tools leveraging the Firm’s in house analytics and IT platforms, as well as providing cutting-edge analysis to the trading and sales teams. The role will require a sharp focus on the evolution of tooling framework and coordinating these efforts with the global Quantitative Modelling and Technology teams to ensure successful integration into the Firm’s systems and frameworks.

What is the opportunity?

The Mutual Fund product team serves as a primary source of product support for US registered and offshore mutual funds across RBC Wealth Management distribution channels. The Product Analyst assists in the development, support, and growth of RBC Wealth Management’s mutual fund platform(s). The Product Analyst assists in the management of key strategic initiatives and vendor relationships designed to support and promote the adoption of mutual fund investments in client portfolios. item.title: Portfolio Administrator
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Portfolio Administrator

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  
As a Portfolio Administrator at RBC Global Asset Management, U.S. (RBC GAM US) you are the key provider of accurate investment portfolio data to RBC GAM-US. Your primary responsibilities encompass three general areas: communication of accurate data to multiple internal groups, accurate investment portfolio reconciliation, and the election and processing of voluntary Corporate Actions.
 
What will you do? 
•    Accurately reconcile investment portfolios – audit accounting data for accuracy and reasonableness, identify and resolve holdings and transactional discrepancies in a timely manner using multiple data sources, and track outstanding issues and ensure resolution.
•    Communicate accurate data to the Investment Management and Client Service teams – communicate critical portfolio information to investment management and client service, and ensure the flow of time sensitive information and follow through on actionable items. 
•    Organize data from multiple sources in a manner that is accurate and can be efficiently interpreted by end-user teams. Notify Investment Teams of portfolio cash balances and pending cash needs.
•    Elect, track and process voluntary Corporate Action for the firm.
•    Contribute to cross-departmental initiatives and work groups. Participate in operational projects focusing on automation, efficiency, and the scalability of Portfolio Administration services.
 
What do you need to succeed?
 
Must Have 
•    Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field
•    1-2 years of financial services industry experience, with working knowledge of fixed income and equity securities
•    Self-starter that is client services and solutions oriented. Ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a team
•    Strong problem solving and strategic thinking skills and capable of meeting tight timelines under high pressure situations with the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
•    Excellent attention to detail with time management skills and the ability to independently manage competing priorities
•    Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUPS, basic formulas)
 
Nice to Have 
•    2-3 years of Fund Accounting and/or Portfolio Administration experience in the asset management industry
•    Working knowledge of various technology platforms:

  • Eagle Investment Systems
  • Bloomberg Terminal
  • Charles River Investment Management Solutions
  • Electra Reconciliation

 

What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
