item.title: Securities Data Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Securities Data Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Securities Data Services (SDS) group within RBC\'s Reference Data Service’s group is responsible for the management of the organization\'s securities reference data repositories. As a Data Analyst you will assist with providing reusable, authoritative, timely, comprehensive, and consistent securities reference data across the organization with special focus on product taxonomy. 

You will play a key role in the management of the organizations securities reference data repository. Success will be accomplished by providing reference data expertise throughout Capital Markets and the operational support of the Securities Reference Data Repository (SRDR) as well as other internal and external repositories.

What will you do?

  • Provide front-line operational support for securities reference data
  • Setup and maintain securities reference data for fixed income, equity, and equity derivative securities, including corporate actions, ensuring that data is accurate and timely
  • Review/investigate data exceptions through the use of data query tools and remediate exceptions as necessary
  • Assist in the implementation of process improvement and system enhancement initiatives by identifying opportunities for automation and by researching the root cause of data quality issues.
  • Contribute to the department knowledge base by creating and updating documentation of supported processes

What you need to succeed?

Must-haves

  • University Degree
  • Good knowledge of different financial product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities)
  • Advanced problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills
  • Experience in developing successful and responsive relationships with a wide number of groups at various levels
  • Good experience using MS Excel, MS Access, and Business Intelligence tools; intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills.
  • Expected daily start time: 10:30am Atlantic but subject to change

Nice-to-haves

  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC)
  • Relevant work experience in the use of reference data across different product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities) within an established financial institution, investment bank or fund management organization
  • Experience with the use of Bloomberg and Reuters Data (Corporate Actions, Reference Data)
  • Working knowledge of ADP/Broadridge settlement system
  • Experience with GoldenSource or any another enterprise data management system

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

item.title: Investment Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Investment Analyst

Job Description

  • PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES  

  • Financial modeling, structuring and underwriting of multifamily real estate transactions with tax credits.
  • Perform detailed analysis on all underwriting elements of a transaction, including but not limited to, the following: Market Analysis, Expense Comp Analysis, and Modeling Sensitivity Analysis.
  • Support Investment Managers with site analysis and partnership negotiations.
  • Prepare and review of Investment Summary and all other materials needed for Investment Committee, including the following:
    • Identification of Investment Highlights and Risks,
    • Market Study Analysis,
    • RBC Underwriting Guidelines and Exceptions documentation complete and accurate,
    • Financing Terms and Reserve Accounts, Guarantees, and Tax Risk Identification.
  • Responsibility for preparation and presentation of rent and expense underwriting meeting materials and follow up on outstanding questions.
  • In conjunction with diligence staff, prepare and submit all documentation required to ensure timely and efficient closing and funding at the lower tier.
  • Review of 3rd party reports and loan documents.
  • Work with the Pricing Group on initial modeling, including initial deal screening with thoughtful and thorough review and analysis of proposed investment opportunities, and structuring and market analysis.
  • Prepare and review materials for Issuance meeting, including sensitivities, and provide support to Originators during the meeting with regards to underwriting and financial modeling.
  • Assist Originators and Investment Associates during pricing guidance process in preparation for Letter of Intent (“LOI”) or Request For Proposal (“RFP”) and provide input on deal metrics and pricing sensitivities.
  • Prepare LOI or RFP based on financial model and pricing guidance for review by internal staff.
  • Structure transactions to RBC standards and proactively identify and mitigate exceptions up-front with oversight from VP-Financial Analysis and Director-Underwriting.
  • Proactively identify operational risks/ control deficiencies in the business
  • Review and comply with Firm Policies applicable to your business activities
  • Escalate operational risk loss events, control deficiencies and risks that you identify to your line manager and the relevant risk and control functions on a timely basis.

  • JOB SPECIFICATIONSAND QUALIFICATIONS

    Basic Qualifications (Legislative Requirement)

  • Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Finance, Accounting, or Real Estate.

  • Other Required Qualifications:

  • A strong interest in real estate investment and/or affordable housing, and excellent quantitative and analytical skills are essential.
  • Proficiency in MS-Office applications is required.

  • Suggested Qualifications:

  • Preference for previous experience in real estate underwriting activities and financial modeling, affordable housing, or tax credit syndication.

Job Summary

RBC Capital Markets is the global investment banking arm of the Royal Bank of Canada (RBC). This position performs financial modeling, analyzes and structures multifamily real estate investments, and prepares sales and underwriting materials. RBC Community Investments (www.rbccm.com/communityinvestments) is a leading national syndicator of real estate tax credit investments, including Federal and State Low Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTCs), and Historic Rehabilitation Tax Credits (HRTCs). The Real Estate Investment Associate will primarily support the deal closing teams to analyze all underwriting elements of the investments and will prepare Investment Summaries, maintain the financial model, analyze rents and expenses and review all related due diligence materials. This position will also at times support the initial bid process by modeling and pricing deals.
